intro: Freycinetia quezonensis, commonly known as the Quezón palm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by drupes that are typically red or yellow when mature. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
